Title: Run Lola Run
Taglines: The Pressure is Rising, The Adrenaline is Rushing, The Clock is Ticking
Production_Co: X-Filme Creative Pool, Westdeutscher Rundfunk (WDR), Arte
Trivia: There are many spirals in the film (stair cases, bar behind phone booth etc). This is because director Tom Tykwer was a fan of 'Alfred Hitchcock''s Vertigo (1958). See more »
Goofs: The reflection of the crew and tripod can be seen when Lola's father enters the car. See more »
Crazy_Credits: "Special thanks to those who ran with us". See more »
Cast: Franka Potente, Moritz Bleibtreu, Herbert Knaup, Nina Petri, Armin Rohde, Joachim Król, Ludger Pistor, Suzanne von Borsody, Sebastian Schipper, Julia Lindig, Lars Rudolph, Heino Ferch
Plot: After a botched money delivery, Lola has 20 minutes to come up with 100,000 Deutschmarks. Lola receives a phone call from her boyfriend Manni. He lost 100,000 DM in a subway train that belongs to a very bad guy. Lola has 20 min to raise this amount and meet Manni. Otherwise, he will rob a store to get the money. Three different alternatives may happen depending on some minor event along Lola's run. Written by Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
Keywords: bechdel test failed, alternative reality, multiple outcomes, repeated event, money
Awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA Film Award. Another 28 wins & 19 nominations.
Actors: Franka Potente, Moritz Bleibtreu, Herbert Knaup
Description: Directed by Tom Tykwer.  With Franka Potente, Moritz Bleibtreu, Herbert Knaup, Nina Petri. After a botched money delivery, Lola has 20 minutes to come up with 100,000 Deutschmarks.
